Poiana Brașov.label: Poiana Brașov
Poiana Brașov.description: Poiana Braşov is the most popular Romanian ski resort and an important tourist centre preferred by many tourists not only from Romania, but also from Italy, France, Germany, Switzerland and other European states. Wikipedia

Big Squaw Mountain Resort.label: Big Squaw Mountain Resort
Big Squaw Mountain Resort.description: Big Squaw Mountain Resort is a ski area in Greenville, Maine. Opened in 1963, the ski area was located on the north side of Big Moose Mountain, overlooking Moosehead Lake. Squaw featured two chairlifts that covered 1,700 vertical feet. Wikipedia

Milwaukee Ski Bowl.label: Milwaukee Ski Bowl
Milwaukee Ski Bowl.description:
Milwaukee Ski Bowl was an alpine ski area that operated in Washington state between 1937 and 1951.
Executives of the Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul and Pacific Railroad built a ski area at Hyak, Washington ... Wikipedia

Aspen Highlands.label: Aspen Highlands
Aspen Highlands.description: Aspen Highlands is a skiing mountain in Aspen, Colorado. It is famous for the Highland Bowl, which provides what some consider some of the most intense skiing in the state. Wikipedia

Great Bear Recreation Park.label: Great Bear Recreation Park
Great Bear Recreation Park.description: Great Bear Recreation Park, more commonly referred to as Great Bear, is a small ski hill in the northeastern section of Sioux Falls, South Dakota, in the United States. Wikipedia

Marble Mountain Ski Resort.label: Marble Mountain Ski Resort
Marble Mountain Ski Resort.description: Marble Mountain is a ski resort located in the town of Steady Brook, on the west coast of Newfoundland in the Long Range Mountains. Wikipedia

Mountain View at Edinboro.label: Mountain View at Edinboro
Mountain View at Edinboro.description: Mount Pleasant of Edinboro is a small ski resort nestled in the "ski country" snowbelt region of northwestern Pennsylvania, USA, near Edinboro, in Erie County. It offers an array of challenging terrain and conditions. Wikipedia

Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort.label: Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort
Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort.description: The Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort is an alpine ski resort in Krasnodar Krai, Russia, located at the Aibiga Ridge of the Western Caucasus along the Roza Khutor plateau near Krasnaya Polyana. Wikipedia

Selwyn Snowfields.label: Selwyn Snowfields
Selwyn Snowfields.description: Selwyn Snowfields is a small ski resort in the northern part of the Snowy Mountains of New South Wales, Australia, in the Snowy River Shire and Kosciuszko National Park. Wikipedia

Ski Idlewild.label: Ski Idlewild
Ski Idlewild.description: Ski Idlewild was a small ski area located in Hideaway Park, Colorado. It began operation in 1961 opened by Dwight and Jean Miller with a blue Pomagalski double chair with shield. Wikipedia

Yabuli Ski Resort.label: Yabuli Ski Resort
Yabuli Ski Resort.description: Yabuli Ski Resort is the largest ski resort in China, including the biggest ski jumping facilities, located in the northeastern province of Heilongjiang. It is 110 mi southeast from Harbin, approximately 2.5hrs by train. Wikipedia

Birds of Prey (ski course).label: Birds of Prey
Birds of Prey (ski course).description: Birds of Prey is a World Cup downhill ski course in the United States, located at Beaver Creek, Colorado. A regular stop on the men's World Cup tour, the races in Beaver Creek are usually held in early December. Wikipedia

Big Rock (ski resort).label: Big Rock
Big Rock (ski resort).description: Bigrock Ski Area is located in Mars Hill, Maine, on the western face of Mars Hill. It is one of the larger ski resorts in the State of Maine with 2 chairlifts, 26 trails, 80% snowmaking, night skiing, and almost 1000 ft of continuous vertical drop. Wikipedia

Buckhorn Ski Club.label: Buckhorn Ski Club
Buckhorn Ski Club.description: Buckhorn Ski and Snowboard Club is located roughly 40 mi north of Los Angeles in the Angeles National Forest. The U.S. Department of Agriculture owns the land and the United States Forest Service administers the area. Wikipedia

Buttermilk (ski area).label: Buttermilk
Buttermilk (ski area).description: Buttermilk Ski Area is frequently considered the easiest skiing mountain in Aspen, Colorado. Buttermilk has also been the host to the ESPN Winter X-games multiple times. It contains three ski areas Tiehack,Main Buttermilk, and West Buttermilk. Wikipedia

Elk Ridge Ski Area.label: Elk Ridge Ski Area
Elk Ridge Ski Area.description: Elk Ridge Ski Area, formerly known as Williams Ski Area before being purchased in 2005 by Fountain Outdoor Recreation Corporation. Wikipedia

Furano Ski Resort.label: Furano Ski Resort
Furano Ski Resort.description: Furano Ski Resort, also known as Furano Ski Area, is a resort in Furano, Hokkaido, Japan, owned and operated by Prince Hotels. Wikipedia

Hidden Valley (New Jersey).label: Hidden Valley
Hidden Valley (New Jersey).description: Hidden Valley was a ski resort in Vernon Township, New Jersey off of County Route 515, near the intersection with Route 94, approximately an hour's drive from the George Washington Bridge. Wikipedia

Hurricane Ridge Ski and Snowboard Area.label: Hurricane Ridge Ski and Snowboard Area
Hurricane Ridge Ski and Snowboard Area.description: The Hurricane Ridge Ski and Snowboard Area is a small ski area located within Olympic National Park south of Port Angeles, Washington, United States. Hurricane Ridge is one of only three lift serviced ski areas operating in a US National Park. Wikipedia

Middlebury College Snow Bowl.label: Middlebury College Snow Bowl
Middlebury College Snow Bowl.description: The Middlebury College Snow Bowl is a ski area in Hancock, Vermont, 13 miles east of Middlebury in the Green Mountains. The site has been owned and operated by Middlebury College since its first trails were cut in 1934. Wikipedia

Mount Whittier Ski Area.label: Mount Whittier Ski Area
Mount Whittier Ski Area.description: Mt. Whittier was a ski area located in West Ossipee, New Hampshire. Though it shared a name with a nearby mountain in the Ossipee Range, the ski area was actually located on Nickerson Mountain. Wikipedia

Niseko Mt. Resort Grand Hirafu.label: Niseko Mt. Resort Grand Hirafu
Niseko Mt. Resort Grand Hirafu.description: Niseko Mt. Resort Grand Hirafu is a ski resort located in the Hirafu area of Kutchan, Abuta District, Hokkaidō, Hokkaidō, Japan. Wikipedia

Snow Park, New Zealand.label: Snow Park, New Zealand
Snow Park, New Zealand.description: Snow Park was a dedicated snowsports terrain park in South Island, New Zealand. It described itself as the "first dedicated freestyle terrain park in the world" when it opened in 2002, and featured a ... Wikipedia

Dollar Mountain.label: Dollar Mountain
Dollar Mountain.description: Dollar Mountain is a ski hill in south central Idaho, part of the Sun Valley ski resort. The treeless Dollar caters primarily to beginner and lower intermediate skiers; the primary mountain for advanced ... Wikipedia
